metadata.Title: CVE-2019-2001 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The permissions on /proc/iomem were world-readable. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation. Product: Android. Versions: Android kernel. Android ID: A-117422211.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2001` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-87-generic - 4.4.0-87.110
linux-image-4.4.0-87-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-87.110
linux-image-4.4.0-87-lowlatency - 4.4.0-87.110

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-87.110').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1026.35').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
